lead_paragraph: At the annual South by Southwest gathering of techies in Austin, Tex., in March, conference organizers had chosen a hangar-size room to accommodate their star speaker: Evan Williams, the co-founder of Twitter, the messaging and social networking site that had become a digital phenomenon.
snippet: Evan Williams may embody a classic Silicon Valley type: the inspired entrepreneur with good ideas for a start-up, but not the leader to execute a sophisticated business strategy.
abstract: Evan Williams may embody a classic Silicon Valley type: the inspired entrepreneur with good ideas for a start-up, but not the leader to execute a sophisticated business strategy.
